Birdfair 2018

Join Park Cameras at Birdfair 2018

This week (17-19th August), the team from Park Cameras will be heading up to Rutland Water for the 30th annual Birdfair!

A key date in the diary for many birdwatchers, it is often described as the birder's 'Glastonbury'. There are a whole range of lectures and events, with talks from some big names - Chris Packham, Andy Rouse and David Lindo to name just a few!

For the 6th year running, Park Cameras will be the leading photographic retailer resident at Birdfair, with a huge stand (OD11) with all the latest gear a bird watcher or photographer could ask for.

What is Birdfair?

Birdfair encompasses the whole spectrum of the birdwatching industry whilst at the same time supporting global bird conservation. This is the event of the year if you’re into birds and wildlife. A wide range of fantastic conservation projects have been supported by Birdfair. Read more

Where will it be held?

The British Birdwatching Fair is held each year at Egleton Nature Reserve, Rutland Water.

Egleton is at the western end of Rutland Water and can be reached via the A6003 from Uppingham or Oakham from the west, and from Stamford (A606/A1) from the East.

Purchase Birdfair Tickets

Here's a little taste of what to expect from Park Cameras at Birdfair 2018:

At Birdfair we’ll have some great stock of the Canon cameras that are ideal to capture some great shots of birds and wildlife, including models such as the EOS-1D X Mark II, EOS 6D Mark II, EOS 7D Mark II and the EOS M50.

Cameras are of course just half of the equation. By visiting the Canon stand in Marquee 4 (Stands 6-9), you’ll be able to get hands on with some fantastic lenses including the EF 500mm lens f/4L IS II USM, and the popular EF 100-400mm f/4.5-5.6L IS II USM to name just few.

By visiting Birdfair in 2018, you’ll be one of the first in the UK to get hands on with the new FE 400mm f/2.8 G Master OSS telephoto lens, and learn for yourself how light and portable the lens is despite its focal length.

In addition to this, we’ll have some fantastic offers on Sony cameras and lenses, including the A7R II, A7 III and the super speedy a9.

If you’re looking for something a little more portable, you’ll be able to get hands-on with the new RX100 VI and the popular RX10 III.

From Nikon, we’ll have a wide selection of cameras and lenses including the D500, D850 and AF-S 200-500mm f/5.6E ED VR – ideal whether you shoot wildlife, birds, planes, or fast-paced sports.

By visiting the Nikon stand in the optics marquee, you’ll also learn how you can roost with eagles using the new Coolpix P1000, featuring an extraordinary 125x optical zoom! Whilst the camera isn’t available in the UK until September, you’ll be able to test it out, and place a pre-order to receive one of the very first in the UK!

This year at Birdfair, Panasonic arguably have one of the best cameras for shooting nature with the LUMIX G9 – a camera that is designed to help you keep up with fast-moving subjects, yet small and light enough to carry on the move.

We’ll have a wide variety of special deals available, both on cameras, but also lenses such as their LEICA 100-400mm and LEICA 200mm lenses.

Often when capturing wildlife, the name of the game is speed – and when trying out the OM-D E-M1 Mark II, you’ll find you have a camera that shoots accurately and quickly in the palm of your hand. By visiting Olympus in Marquee 4 (Stand 15), you’ll be able to get hands-on with this camera as well as the range of lenses available.

For something more compact, yet rugged enough for your adventures, you’ll be able to get a great deal on the Olympus TOUGH TG-5!

If you use an X-Series camera, then by visiting the Park Cameras stand at Birdfair, you’ll be able to get hands on with the recently announced XF200mm f/2 R LM O.I.S WR telephoto lens! Robust and lightweight, you’ll see how you this lens can help you get some great shots, especially when paired with the FUJINON XF1.4X TC F2 WR Teleconverter. Why not bring your camera along and try the lens out for yourself at Birdfair!?

At Birdfair, you’ll be able to test out some of the best tripods, monopods, heads and accessories from industry leaders Manfrotto and Gitzo. Technical experts will be available through the show to help you find the ideal product for your needs – all with exclusive Birdfair deals!
